rComments: This class is not like learning a language! His accent is hard to understand and goes to fast to take good notes. Though i was gonna major in linguistics but the lectures were boring and I fell asleep in class multiple times. i hated how the 10 tests and quizzes were online and on your own time instead of during class. Not flexible about  deadlines

Adrian is an amazing professor. He's funny and engaging, as well as really informative about what he's talking about. You can tell he enjoys what he's teaching, which made going to class all the better! He also really cared about what the students needed and would take the time to clarify anything we asked.  100% recommend him to anyone!

Adrian is the cutest man!! His giggles are infectious. When he has a good time, you have a good time (and he always has a good time!). Very helpful and spends extra time for clarification. Accommodates due dates to fit the class' understanding of the  material, but Semantics 1 is a pretty basic level. Great prof, easy A. Take this class :)!

Adrian is an all right professor.  He can be unclear at times, but the material is ridiculously easy.  Adrian spends too much time explaining simple concepts, but this may be due to the nature of Semantics 1 as it is meant to be geared toward new Ling. students.  The class is very easy and Adrian's teaching style excels in more complicated classes.

I took Semantics 1 with Adrian and I absolutely LOVE him. He has the cutest accent and when he gets excited he does this little giggle that is amazing. Super interesting class. If you go to class and take notes, you should be able to get an A no problem!
Great professor making clear what is so opaque in the readings. Very enthousiastic. Complex concepts are explained in a way that makes sense. Don't take this class if you didn't LOVE semantics I.

hrmm..  well he was pretty enthusiastic but he seemed to kind of wing class as he went along. his grading was no good. no tests, but everything depended on hw and attendance which could easily screw someone over for a few honest mistakes.

Adrian is so cute! He'll make the dorkiest linguistics jokes that no non-ling majors understand. Cool guy. Easy class (at least compared to other upper divs in the major). Manageable workload. Just try to be engaged and you'll enjoy it.

Wow, if you're not majoring in Language or Linguistics, don't attempt this class. He may as well be speaking Greek. Everything seems to come from the readings but these are highly technical and confusing if you do not have some background.
From the accent to the vigorous hair pulling and chalk board action, he is all together rad. His humor and boundless enthusiasm will make you smile.

He is the sweetest, funniest, most adorable professor i've had! Possibly my favorite professor so far in my college career. The class isn't impossible, but not too easy either. Adrian is really passionate about linguistics, and his exams are open note! He is not one to budge about grades though. I loved this class! oh, and he had a cute accent.
